Reviews.Title: Little tricky putting in the battery!
Reviews.Author: J. Futrell
Reviews.Content: This item was not constructed for shaky hands....I did not have a problem with puttin gin the battery. However I was surprise to find that the remote is 4 parts screwed together. I did not expect each piece to separate. I was kinda expecting to just remove the back from the remote and place the battery in its place and screw the back, back on. Nah, Not really that easy, but no problems and no complaints. I will buy it again. (o yeah...the battery that came with the remote was dead. so yeah i got to redo the whole battery replacing thing over. Beware on my battery volt reading meter says the GP brand of batteries.....are only about half charged. ( I have only tested the A27 & A23 sizes )

Reviews.Title: Handy Remote
Reviews.Author: J. Graganta "JG"
Reviews.Content: The remote is a very handy way to activate and deactivate the alarm system.  This is especially true if the control box is mounted in a location where a PIR or door sensor is mounted and will activate the alarm when trying to get to the controller to deactivate.  Range of the remote is adequate (25-30 feet) from the control box through wood walls.  The original battery with the remote did not last very long, maybe three months.  The battery is an 27A 12V battery & in my area is not common.  It is NOT similar to the 23A 12V that is more commonly used (and available) in some devices. The 27A used in the remote is the same length as the 23A, but it is a smaller diameter.  The 27A 12V was only available at Radio Shack in my area.
